review: I'm definitely a fan of T.G.I. Friday's!  I fell in love with their Jack Daniel's sauce years ago and haven't been able to shake my craving since.   I met a friend at the Stonecrest location for dinner Friday night.  They were pretty packed, but we were seated within minutes.  The service was very good, too.  Our waitress was  friendly, attentive  and good about recommending items on the menu!  This is rare when you go to places like this and are packed from wall to wall.   The food was really good, as always.  If you decide to go, I would try the Tropical Mojito!  I'm not a big drinker, but I ended up having two of these!  It went down easy, had the right amount of liquor, and the right amount of sweetness to make this amateur drinker order another round!    If you're a sports fan, they have TVs almost everywhere and someone at the bar "rings a bell" anytime your favorite team scores.   Overall, the ambiance of this location was a lot of fun, their staff is friendly and focused on making sure you enjoy your dining experience, and the food and drinks are consistently good!
A great Friday's. The place was packed on a Thursday! This is great for the Stonecrest area.

My husband and I went here for his birthday on a Tuesday night and it was the first time there wasn't a line out the door.  Overall, I give the place 3 stars.  The food was okay.  We both ordered medium burgers and they came out well done.  That's the reason I generally order medium because it's rare that you order a medium cooked piece of beef and get it.  Despite the burger being cooked for too long, it was pretty good!  The service was nothing to write home about.  Our waitress was a bit slow and it took over 20 minutes for our drinks to arrive.  She was friendly though and that's always good.  Overall, I would go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice amongst all the restaurants in the Stonecrest area.

I visited this place twice. I went on a Saturday for lunch with a friend. The waitress seemed new and forgetful but extremely nice. I ordered their version of tuna a mahi tuna crisp (I believe is the name), macaroni and cheese bites, and meatballs. The mahi tuna crisp was horrible. I guess the word for that plate was bland. The macaroni/cheese bites, and meatballs were great but a bit over priced if you ask me. Regardless I enjoyed lunch so much I went back Sunday evening with my mate. We sat at the bar and I ordered meatballs, pork wontons, and macaroni and cheese bites. I loved the macaroni/cheese bites, my favorite item on the menu. The problem was the waitress, who only took our orders and brought the food. after eating the meal the plan was to relax and have some drinks, the waitress basically forgot we existed. I understood that it was a busy night so I waited about 15 minutes quietly. Many of the other passing waitresses looked at my party and I realizing we were waiting for service but looked away quickly not wanting to be bothered by helping paying customers I assumed. After becoming impatient I started waving at my waitress who was only 15 feet away from me, but apparently that wasn't enough because she still ignored me. I became so angry I told my mate I was not planning to spend another minute at the venue waiting for service, and I refused to spend any more of my money just to be ignored. I took out my debit card and raised my arm and in a blink my waitress came to my aid...REALLY!?!?!? I usually leave an above average tip but with no service I paid what I owed and left 000 accross the tip line. The macaroni/cheese bites are not worth the service from TGIF. Next time I will stop by IHOP across the street before even thinking about going to TGIF.

LONG WAIT, COLD FOOD, or WRONG FOOD...take your pick! The hostess and servers are friendly, but you will WAIT on your food, or it will be COLD or it will be WRONG. My Husband and I went to TGI Fridays at Stonecrest and we found a great parking space and figured this was the 1st sign of a great experience. Well that was about the only indicator.  We were seated by a very friendly host and after that it went down hill. Our server came over and greeted us then took our drink orders.  The turnaround time for that was timely.  We put in an appetizer order and our main entrees order. Then we proceeded to wait about 1.5 hours and during that time, my husband commented that he observed a lot of folks waiting on food or sending it back because it was wrong or cold. Eventually our server kept checking in with us during the long wait and she finally said they were backed up in the kitchen.  Well by that time my husband and I were famished and couldn't wait. so we paid for our beverages and left.  I dont' know what the root cause of the delay in food, cold food and repeatedly taking back food, but the servers were very visible and strong in number but it turns out the expediting and preparing of the food is SUBPAR.

The food and drinks were great - berry acai chiller and strawberry basil margarita (though it was supposed to have been made with Patron, it was clearly made with Jose. You could taste it the cuervo) and two appetizer samplers. All were great but the service was horrible. We were there 10 minutes seated at our table before we seen our waitress. She took our drink order. We received water 10 minutes later and still waited yet another 10 minutes before our cocktails arrived.  While everything tasted great the service again was abysmal. Do yourself a favor and find another Friday's to go to.

This has to be the biggest Friday's I've ever seen! Came here for a friends birthday party in the private room upstairs. Was pretty nice! The food though, ugh. It took for ever for the food to get there in which I got the sampler appetizer.The fried string beans were gross, though I love them everywhere else apparently. Not a place I would eat at again but from what I hear the bartenders pour with a heavy hand!

Food good--what you would expect from TGIF. I rated this one star because of the slow and poor service. Walked in to pick up my "to go" order and wasn't greeted by the hostess or wait staff. Walk to the "to go" counter and was ignored by the person behind the counter. That person walked away and then another server came to the counter, entered info in register and walked away. Never acknowledged me or let me know someone would be with me shortly. Continued to stand there while at least 5 other wait staff walked past me. While I was standing there, I was in the hostess' line of sight the entire time. It was only after I approached the hostess to find out "if anyone was planning on helping me today" that she called over the appropriate wait person to assist me. Epic Fail TGIF.

This is one of the most unorganized businesses I have ever been too.  The food was not worth wait.  There is nothing good to be said about the management staff either.  Too many other eating  choices to pick from where you won't have a bad experience.  Called them to inquire about wait time and was told "there was no wait".  Our party of 5 left another establishment and when we arrived - were told there WAS a wait of 25 mins. or more.  The mgr was not interested in assisting us or compensating us for being told by his staff there was no wait.  After waiting and waiting, they attempted to seat another group of 5 that came in after us,  until we protested and then were seated.  One of our group got their food way before the rest of us and had to go ahead and eat so it would not get cold.    Seemed to be a lot of confusion going on with orders around us.  Not worth the hassle.

I swear this is the worst TGIF! From the servers to the managers! Every time I'm here I get the worst customer service. The servers are very lazy! Ask them for a refill they act like you asking for gold! Lol! Never will go back again

This place is your normal chain restaurant... Except it stays HELLA packed! I was watching the Bama game and had no problems finding a seat at the bar.  Food: meh. Sizzling chicken & cheese Libations: Cosmo... I asked for fresh lime juice she said sure... Then I saw her pour it from a plastic bottle. Go figure Side note: it's waaaay crowded on Sunday and not for football

I never thought I would give a restaurant at Stonecrest Mall a 5 but it pays to have great customer service. The waitress was very attentive, the food was hot and fresh, and we were seated quickly. I hope when I return I will have the same experience!

One Word: Awful! I went here for my sister's birthday to enjoy a nice meal with my husband and her husband. We were seated very quickly the waitress was nice got our drink orders waters, coke, and margarita. Nothing hard there, we got our drinks shortly (except) the margarita and proceeded to order our food. After we ordered our food we were left at the table for almost 30 minutes waiting for the appetizer which was some flat bread. We got our flat bread ate it and  proceeded with another long wait for our food and margarita.  They brought out the food after what seemed like an eternity-20 minutes after the appetizer. I got the "sizzling" chicken and shrimp, when it arrived it was COLD mashed potatoes, American cheese product barely melted, with 4 shrimp and chicken medallions. The funny thing is they brought it on a fajita plate and there was no "sizzle"-- just condensation smoke from the cold food hitting warm air. I've never in all the times I've eaten at Fridays been so dissatisfied! I asked my waitress to warm up the food and they did in the oven which dried out my shrimp and mash potatoes and finally after a hour of dining we received the margarita! Stay away go somewhere else the staff that works here sucks, my waitress had the nerve to blame the bartender for not making my drink within the hour of dining!  We barely got a sorry... It's awful not worth the one star!  Cold food, uncaring staff (especially the cook who thought it was OK to serve cold sizzling food! ) Never ever again!

It took at least 40mins to get a table.  We ordered appetizers and drinks at the same time and the food come out 20mins ahead if the drinks. Complained to the manager and shit still took forever to come out... hell its been 40mins since we sat down and I still don't have my glass of water.   TGIF should send someone here to teach them customer service and how to manage a restaurant. Update finally got food still no water. . Frys were not cooked. .but steak was good. .moo'ing...lol

Had family in town for a convention...we decided to grab a late night bite; before going to bed. Despite the sanitation grade of B, we decided to patronize this establishment.  BAD IDEA. Halfway through our meal we noticed a small ant on the table. At that moment we asked for the check. While waiting for the check we saw and killed 2 more ants. At this point we brought it to the attention of the manager (Thomas). Thomas was not at all apologetic...he did offer us to change tables. I cant wait to contact corporate next week...this place needs to close down and try again ( with customer service, food and sanitation).

This is a normal TGIF no extras, no frills....we were seated promptly which was a plus for me(for a table of 7).  This was on a Saturday afternoon, it was crowded but not overly crowded, the wait for a seat was about 5 minutes. Once we were seated the waitress attended to us right away, taking our drinks orders first.  I ordered a hot chocolate, the waitress requested an alternative just in case they were out.(they were out of hot chocolate).  We then ordered appetizers and our meal, I was so surprised to see how quickly our food came out, we got the entree even before we finished with our appetizers.  It was like the chef was waiting on our order to make it. The staff was very attentive and efficient, just some good old customer service.

This place is awful!!! We waited for our server and when she finally showed we ordered a bruschetta appetizer, a soft drink, a tea and a Corona.  Why did I never get my beer? The soft drink and tea came after 20 mins.  My beer never made it to me. I told them to forget it because I could see the bar where they had none and a six pack of bottles came up with another waitress. The bartender out two in a mini fridge for a few minutes to chill and after seeing that I was done.  Let me back up...we went around 7 pm.  Before a movie to grab a bite to eat.  So we didn't have 2hrs. to wait for a meal.   The burger I ordered was burned...fries cold.  The chicken strips for my daughter were uncooked.   I could go on and on but I won't.  It was a crappy experience.  So, nope will not return.

Went with my hubby for lunch. The place is new as of now and super clean! The food was ok, a tad bit better than Applebees Chilis etc. the waitress was nice, food was hot and they have a loft along with a greatly designed bar with nice sized tvs for those of you into sports. I would return again!

I love this place. I come here with my family all the time. The atmosphere is great. The drinks are amazing. It has a great vibe and the wait staff is top notch. Having said all that, THE COOK NEEDS TO BE FIRED!!! Not once, BUT TWICE I ordered a cheeseburger medium and not once but TWICE I received a black hockey puck. Immediately when I showed the debacle to my waitress, they said, and I quote, "THAT'S NOT MEDIUM." So even though I love TGI Fridays, I say this, "if your servers know what a medium burger looks like then why the hell don't your cooks??? PREACH

HORRIBLE smh. All I can say is this place was complete madness when I arrived. We were told that it would only be a 15 min wait which yeah they executed that portion of the promise however when we got to the bar we sat and ordered some drinks while we were waiting for our food. The lady working in the bar area was really nice but didn't listen very well. She rang us up for drinks that weren't even ours for starters. Well by the time the drinks were ordered and almost complete our hostess came over and told us the booth was ready so we requested that our order be transferred to the kitchen. Well when we were seated at the table I requested that the new server repeat the order that the bartender took. Luckily I did this because the orders weren't quite correct. All of the drinks came and low and behold they weren't up to par. AT ALL. Just a tip.. Don't order the "BFM" margarita or whatever it's called because for the price of that little drink you can go with the ultimate margarita instead. When I received my drink it was basically all ice and no alcohol. I sent it back and had them re-do this drink because at this point it had to be a joke. Somebody else in my party ordered the ultimate mojito and the person brought out an ultimate margarita! I mean it was just a mess I was ready to walk out at this point. When the food arrived one person in my party ordered the 3-in-one appetizer deal they have and let me tell you it was just that. You get a lot more food when you order this dish with Applebee's or even Chili's! Our waiter I forgot his name but he was so nice and patient with all of these orders we were sending back to the kitchen! I'll never eat here again.

Cool place good atmosphere, first time going since it opened up..I probably won't go back. We came in and had to wait awhile, when I got to my table ordered my food it took longer than usual to get my plate me, I ha a feeling something was going to happen as it always does..while everyone else was eating I was waiting for my food... After I asked the lady "where's my food? You should have brought it out with everyone else?" (I was upset by this point and wanted to leave)She said "oh I'm sorry" and retrieved my food which was probably sitting there waiting to be brought out..it was cold and nasty like I predicted I was pissed.. I hate waiting for my food and the waiter looked inexperienced and just unenergetic won't be back! I would give it zero stars if I could but hey. First impression needs to be your best and you failed.

Its TGIF so dint have high expectations. We first decided on the Thai pork tacos which is very small as meant to be an appetizer. Then  I got the sizzling chicken and spinach which was good and gilled the tummy, nothing special. My parents got the sizzling steak and spinach and the Mexican mixed grill( i think thats what its called) and opinions are the same. The brownie dessert was the typical nothing to brag home about

Eh... I guess people really like this place. We went in on Veterans Day so it was pretty crowded, waited about 30 mins to be seated which wasn't too bad considering the holiday. Food was really good! I ordered salmon with rice and veggies. The reason I didn't give that extra star was because I really didn't like the seating....... Not too comfortable for Big breasted women. LOL!

...Mike was the server of the day & his long island teas were the  ! We had the pick 3 appetizers and doubled up on the mozzarella sticks. The boneless wings w jack Daniels sauce were scrump-deli-ciouuuuus! We ate at the bar and it was messy. Actually sat down and had to wait awhile until it was cleaned by the bartender. Other than that,  it was an enjoyable afternoon and would probably go back.  My cousin used his TGIF card point / reward card and we had a good time.

I went there to dine in. The front counter folks are rude and don't acknowledge you when you walk in. This one young lady stood there talking to her friend and didn't even say good evening or can I help you. The waiter we had was excellent and the food was okay. I loved my veggie burger. I went a couple of weeks later to get the black bean veggie burger and was disappointed that all of the ingredients were not on it, but they were charging me the same price. Interestingly enough I had the same snobby inattentive front desk person to take my carry out order. She was very nasty when I wanted to return it and get my money back and disregarded my statements about the missing ingredients. Needless to say they've lost me as a customer for their poor customer service!

The one star is for the hostess. Period. The food delivery was slow and flavor mediocre at best. Every drink we received from the bar wasn't garnished. The server was slow and not attentive. Not only was our service slow but once the food was received 2 of 4 ppl orders were wrong so we had to send the food back and wait even longer.

Called at 12:30am to place a carry out order she told me I would have to come inside and place my order. Arrived 10 minutes later to have someone tell us they weren't taken orders any more the kitchen closes at 1am. Now why didn't the dummy on the phone tell us that so we could have kept it moving. It's ALWAYS something with this location from the time they've opened. Before them I loved TGIF but now they have changed that with LACK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE! Customer service is everything!
The service was terrible. Food was cool but it would've been better if the service didn't suck!
Horribleness!!!!! Bad service and cold food there really isn't anything else to say but consider yourself warned!!!!!

OK...I am a huge fan of the Stonecrest area.  I don't live very far from this shopping center and I enjoy the convenience of everything being so close.  This place is a huge disappointment.  Its easily a hit or miss.  But I will agree with other reviewers in saying their service is horrible.  I came into today with my son and was seated immediately.  Nevertheless we were at our table for over 10 minutes and no waiter/waitress had come over to even get our drinks.  The newer waitress saw me getting ready to leave and asked if I had been helped.  I wasn't her table to serve but she helped anyway (this is the ONLY reason they got 3 stars).  Again, its very hit or miss as far as what kind of service you will get.  Either they are understaffed or they are just rude.  I find you may get better service going during the week and non peak hours.  I won't be returning here again.

This review is specifically for Angela, our server yesterday.  We had an event in a private dining room, and despite it being a energetic bunch who kept her on her toes, she was friendly and efficient.  She was able to anticipate our needs and involve herself in the festivities without being the least bit intrusive. The numerous complaints about service could not have possibly come from anyone seated in her section.  The most telling thing that I can share is this.  My husband is very difficult/ impossible to please and I often have to force him to leave servers a respectable 15-20%.  However, he was EXTREMELY generous to her without any prodding, saying the she earned every cent of it.
They  SAT us at a dirty table that smelled like a wet dirty rag bathroom. The restroom was absolutely disgusting. We just got up and left instead of having lunch

I given this place two tries and will never go back.The service is awful.The 1st time went the sever never came back and then we had to ask for the check.The 2nd time they brought my daughters food out after we had finished eating. Change starts with management.

Worst service, management and kitchen EVER!  LIKED LIKED LIKED LIKED LIKED LIKED  Big Booth  Disliked Disliked Disliked Disliked  Restaurant was empty in our section but service was slow  No refills No condiments  Dinner took entirely too long we almost never got it until we complained Orders were wrong  No attention whatsoever and our sever was the bartender with an empty bar, yet we received no help  Manager wasn't necessarily helpful but she did get our food that was almost 1hr out.. So...  It was a mess.. :-( I was shocked at how lack luster everything was

I truly wish that I could give this place negative stars......the service was horrible and slow as hell. my wife and I had to wait 10 minutes after being seated to get our drinks ordered. Then it took the waiter another 15 minutes to bring my drink. Finally we ordered our food and they brought my food and by the time I was finished they still had not brought my wife's food. Please, please, please be warned do not go here unless you have a couple hours to waste
Horrible food, Horrible drinks, Horrible service, Horrible prices.  Save your time and money and choose another restaurant.

We ordered take out on a Sunday afternoon and had a very good experience.  The person who took our order over the phone was very friendly. When we arrived we were greeted by a waiter at the entrance and directed to the Take Out pickup area.  On our way we passed the person who worked in the takeout area and with a big smile she told us that she would be right over to assist us.  She came over within a minute and got our order. She let us check the bag to make sure that everything was correct then we paid. When we got home and ate the food was delicious!  I read some of the reviews before ordering from this location but went anyway because we've been holding onto gift cards for a few years and wanted to finally use them. We went to another location a couple of years ago to use the cards on a dine in visit but couldn't get a waiter or waitress to help us after a long while so we left. Because of that and the reviews I read here, I wasn't expecting much in the way of customer service but was very pleasantly surprised at how nicely everything was handled.

It was about 15 of us.  I understand that big parties can be a challenge, BUT IF YOU CAN'T HANDLE IT SAY SOMETHING.  First, it took them almost 2-hours to seta us (this was after we finally went talk to the manager).  That was our sign to leave but we stayed.  We were seated upstairs with only ONE waiter, YES ONE waiter who was only interested in watching the Philadelphia Eagels football game.  It took over 30 minutes to get our drinks (main orders were water - I guess our waiter had to go to a stream to get it!).  The waiter kept mentioning he had to fix everything himself and prefer no help because he didn't want to share his tips.  Yes, he literally told us that.  As the waiter was taking our orders I requested he bring the kids food first since they weree hungry.  Of course that didn't happen.  Dinner took entirely too long so again we contacted the manager then it started coming out.  My 3-year old niece had the mac-n-cheese that came out cold.  I know this because I tasted prior to letting her eat it.  I had the unlimited apps in which I only got one order because the food took so long.  Orders were wrong.  My girlfriend cancelled her salad order since it took 1 1/2 hours to make.  Others cancelled as well.  We were all starving and irritable by now.  The kids were half sleep at this point so we began paying our check and left. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.  We will NEVER return!

Allison was great!!!!!!! She was the server.  Drink was amazing ultimate long island blueberry. Try it!!! Food was amazing great service ,great price, . Must try it. I'm sure you won't be discouraged.  Go THERE!!!!!!!! Management was also great her name was amber came by to visit the table. :):):):)

Wait time for endless appetizer way to slow if you advertise it don't act like you don't want to uphold it, by taking your time to bring it out in hopes of customers not ordering anymore!!!!!   REALLY!!!!!!

Waitress and staff were really nice. Other than that everything else was either out, wrong, or horrible. We ordered a strawberry mule- didn't have the sugar rim( tasted good tho). Husband ordered Bloody Mary excited for the stuffed olive- didn't have any of the garnish or spicy salt rim and no olive! We got as far as the apps. Thankfully it took us a while to decide what we wanted and didn't order BEFORE the apps came out. Ahi crisps tasted as bad as they looked. Jack Daniels chicken strips are nothing like I've had at any other- not strips more like blobs and the jack Daniels sauce wasn't jack Daniels sauce more like some weird vinegar spicy concoction. When we did try to order(just before tasting the apps) they were out of rib eye and flat irons which I guess is fortunate for us so we didn't have to waste another penny or taste bud on this food. Certainly nothing like Vegas Friday's Didn't check the receipt until leaving-they even charged us wrong price on drinks.

This place is beyond bad. Please remember during this visit it was NOT CROWDED. It was around 2pm middle of the week & after being seated our order was taken & it took about 50 minutes to get our food, almost. Again NOT CROWDED and no special order, no steak, no special dietary needs, no add this or take that, just basics. When the food was about to come, our waitress/bartender tells us on the way out somebody ran into somebody with the entrance door to the kitchen. If you didnt know, restaurants like this have an IN ONLY & EXIT ONLY door JUST for this reason. Most places wont have a door at all also to prevent this.  This caused another 40 minutes to be added to our wait time. Before you ask why I didnt leave at that point its because my date wanted to stay though I was highly opposed to it, I only gave in for medical issues she has. The last straw was bringing the wrong thing out, the waitress/bartender not being anywhere to be seen most of the visit for me to even tell her i wanted to leave sooner (still had to pay for drinks). Then for compensation I was offered chips & salsa (I hate salsa but was told they dont have queso). Then I was told finally my bill would be reduced. At this point money or not I did have other things to do. Oh and dont get me started on the fact the reason we came was for the unlimited apps but they're not corporate so blah blah. Every other TGI's in metro Atlanta for the most offer it but the one in "our" community doesn't. Go figure.

Really nice environment upstairs, very pleasant surprise. Wonderful service as well. My girlfriend and I ordered the endless app's and had a couple drinks and enjoyed it. We will definitely be going back soon.
The place was cold.  I appreciate being taken out for lunch but it took 67 minutes ago just to get my appetizer.  The service was slow and the facility was 20% full.
My experience was horrible at this location. The list of everything that went wrong is too long to list them so  im gonna just say i will never visit any TGI Friday in the Atlanta/surrounding area.

Waitress nice enough.  Food was poorly done. Pecan crusted chicken salad; chicken is cold, forgot the blue cheese.  Floor is slippery because its needs a good cleaning. Everything needs a good cleaning. Very poor representation of a TGIF.

This is one of the biggest Friday's I have been to.  You really can't go wrong with Friday's food.  The service can be sketchy depending on which location you dine at.  This one in particular was in a cluster of like restaurants close to Stonecrest Mall.  We were able to sit upstairs, but the projector screen was not on.  I am not sure if it wasn't working or if it is only used in certain scenarios.  The restaurant was packed, but there was so much space with the loft area, that it wasn't that bad.  I ordered the Sicilian Stacked Burger.  I don't know when Friday's got these fantastic burgers on their menu, but I have been a fan from the first bite.

For starters the menu and pricing  are not accurate at all. I attempted to order three different  items and our waitress  stated " you cant order that appetizer "..she pointed  to a few different  choices. .Too many young people in management  who probably  have no business running  a restaraunt. NOT WORTH YOUR  MONEY. GO TO LONG HORNS OR APPLE BEES INSTEAD.
Robert the manager said even though the restaurant closed at 2a.m. the kitchen closes a little after 12a.m. who ever heard of such?  Mind blown!
Horrible service. I left rushed, wrong food was bought, & the server had a nasty attitude. I will NOT be returning here. I rather take the trip to Kennesaw.

This place had good food although the prices were so high that I don't care to go back. The meals were close to $20 a piece for a small portion of food that wasn't perfection. The service was good, the atmosphere was nice , and the restaurant was clean, but I am a baller on a budget. It is open late though which is another plus. I'll stick to Chilli's.

I saw that this place had some negative reviews. I decided to try it anyway. There's a new general manager, Shawn Crenshaw, who Recently took over. I have to say my experience was quite different from the others. The staff was very attentive and friendly. Kay, the bartender was phenomenal. The manager came by to inquire about my service. I also witnessed him checking with other guests during my visit. They have upgraded the menu since my last visit to another location. I was pleasantly surprised by the change.  The food was great. I tried the Cajun chicken pasta for the first time. Very tasty. I will definitely be back to check out the playoff games and the night scene.  I don't like driving into the city too often to dine. So this place is a welcome change.  Definitely give it a shot.

We tried this TGI Fridays today on our way home from a trip we made to Atlanta. The staff is very nice, I was pretty happy with our server but there were too many issues when it came to our food and drinks. My daughter ordered one of those passion fruit hand crafted drinks which took about 15 mins. longer than the other drinks to get to our table, it wasn't even an alcoholic beverage- which I would expect to wait a little longer for. We (husband, daughter, and myself) all ordered our entrées at the same time, my daughter and I ordered the same exact meal but the server helping out only brought out 2 of our entrées, not even the two that were the same. One of our meals was missing the shrimp, I had to wave someone down to ask about it and was told that the kitchen was backed up and they were working on getting the shrimp out to me....why wasn't that mentioned when the food was brought out? I shouldn't have to wave somone down to find out that info.! We didn't get the third entree until about another 20 mins. later, during that time I did not want my family to wait to eat so at this point my family is half way through their meal when we get the third entrée. The  missing shrimp didn't get to the table until after the third entrée was delivered, at least 20 mins. after the meal that the shrimp goes with was brought to the table, just ridiculous! Aside from these issues the food was subpar, I have eaten at Friday's plenty of times and have enjoyed their food and service,  this was such a disappointing experience. I will NEVER eat at this Fridays again! The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars and nothing less is because I liked our server.

I have been to this location twice and each experience has been terrible, the staff acts as though it's a burden to take care of customers . The first experience no one even checked on us after being seated . Then the waitress was sooooo busy that it took her another 30 mins to take our order . 2nd experience the waitress was very rude she kept walking pass, not asking if we needed anything I needed a water refill for over 30 mins as well as was ready for my check, I finally had to ask another waitress to get our waitress to come to our table . I probably will not go back go this location ever.

the worst restaurant I've ever been to. food took 4ever to come out. ice machine to make drinks didn't work. they where out of potato's . was given the wrong food, was waiting for a drink from the bar it took 30 min come to find out it was brought to the wrong table ,was given hard grilled bread .Manager was like a chicken with his head cut off waitress was the same way . Horrible

Me and my husband have come here a few times, but I will not go back to this location, the customer service is poor, the food took so long and I had to send it back because my chicken was not all the way cooked, this is the second time this has happened . I did speak to the manager which was a big waist of time. Save yourself the money and the hassle.

The only reason why I attempted to go here was because my dad wanted to go. the customer service was really good I want to go ahead and say that stuff.  the food however was awful the fries were lukewarm very hard the potato skins I ordered even though I ordered them with no cheese and no bacon they were fried extremely hard it was just awful I can't say it enough just awful!!!!!! the drink was watered down i ordered a Hawaiian drink, the sliders were mediocre I'm going to have to give them two thumbs down

You're better off somewhere else if you want a peaceful meal and have a conversation with your party. The music was so loud we had to txt each other to communicate.  Food was over priced and just ok with the exception of my fries. They died hours before they were served with my meal. Not sure what this place is like any other time (I dropped by on a Friday night) but I won't be back to find out.

Just left. So done with them. I tried to give them a chance because the last time they said they had new management and were trying to change their image.  Well tonight we waited an hour for food that was horrible.  Service upstairs was good but the kitchen ruined the experience.  Sorry Amber, you did your best!

The atmosphere and music are good. However, the mashed potatoes taste like they are from a box, my steak wasn't cooked to my liking, and the broccoli was extremely undercooked with leaves still on it.

My Mango Lemonade "Slushie" wasn't a Slushie. It looks like they mixed mango flavoring with lemonade and filled the cup up with mostly crushed ice. There's nothing "Slushie" about it. Otherwise the meal was okay. The server took way too long to get to our table on a "not even close to crowded" Monday night. Sat here for 20 minutes before I got a drink.

The food and service was decent. However the atmosphere was HORRIBLE! We felt like we were in a nightclub, instead of a restaurant. The music was too loud, we couldn't hear each other. I had a headache by the time we left. I couldn't finish my food either because I was  miserable due to the loud music and my oncoming headache. We'll never return to this location. Possibly not even another location, if they all play the music above club level decibels.

Yep I can see why this place got bad reviews, long wait times to get seated, forget waitresses and slow bartenders. I went here only once and I vowed to never return again this place was fully staff on the weekends however, it took the hostess 10 minutes to assist me mainly because she was talking to her friends.  When I did get a seat I ordered a drink man it took the bartender 20 minutes to make the drink and an additional 5 minutes for the waitresses to bring it and it was like hardly nobody in customers in there!  The waitress apologized and she told me that she forgot I was a customer inside of this place. And when I got the drink it tasted like per water instead of some watermelon Amsterdam crap I ordered.

My car was broken into in the parking lot.... TGIF management and employees were not willing to offer any assistance... and all they keep saying was that they WERE NOT responsible to anything!! Cameras are in the parking lot but apparently they do not overlook the entire parking lot.
The worse.  Medium rare.  Done to a crisp.  Poor service. No discount for military members. Ughhh. The worse.

The worst experience I have ever had here. Our waitress name was Tameka and she could really use some retraining. I mean she tended to every table around us. I mean bringing out food and napkins giving refills. While we sat her with empty glasses. After the 3rd round of passing our table we had to get her attention to get a refill. Extra napkins never got to our table until we asked the manager for them after she never bought them back like she said she would. As a place that we have come to and had GREAT SERVICE. I am highly disappointed. You all have this Endless App promotion and it is taking damn near 30mins in between the orders to come out. I only gave one star because I couldn't leave nothing.

This is probably one of the worst TGIF Fridays that I've ever been to the service was pretty decent but the cook time for the food was way too long.  It took 30 to 45 minutes to get there food one of the items that we ordered was a salad does it really take 30 minutes to make a salad. And the salad was supposed to have chicken on it, it looked like it had half of a chicken tender chopped up.  The chicken cobb salad was mainly lettuce with a FEW pieces of bacon and chicken. My Jack Daniels chicken sandwich was pretty decent.  Please save your money and go somewhere else.

Customer service is mediocre. There is always a wait but plenty empty tables . That's because of short staffing .  But here's a note . With the endless appetizers for $ 10 you have to get the same item over and over. You cannot switch. It about a 15?wait for the next item. This location does NOT honor the promotions online. It's a franchise.

Went to TGI for drinks and late night dinner. Drinks were weak, so if you're looking for a stronger drink I suggest you go to the Mexican restaurant. Service was ok this time only because I sat at the bar. Food took 40 minutes, but at least it was hot. I ordered the rib and shrimp meal. The ribs were moist and juicy and the shrimp was hot and fresh. My husband ordered the chicken and shrimp served on cast iron. The chicken and mashed potatoes were a little in the dry side and the shrimp had a scorch taste to it. Advised the bartender to only be told that's how it's suppose to taste. Wow, ok.

Really unique location, two stories with two bars. The staff was very friendly and we were promptly served and had a great time! The management came around to ask us how everything was and if they could get anything for us. They even blessed my date when he sneezed! Clean restrooms, great food, will definitely return if I'm ever in the area.
They still have a 74 health inspection score. This is ridiculous. We dont have a lot of restaurants over here and they continue to disappoint.

This is a nice location with two levels for customers to dine on. I took my mother here for her birthday and the staff was really attentive. We tried their Jack Daniels Ribs and they were cooked perfectly. The manager also came around to the tables to check up on us to ensure our service was ok. The wait was a little long, but once we got seated everything went really well. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

I love the endless apps but this place is hit or miss when it comes to the food and service. We tend to sit at the bar most times when we come because you will get quicker service. Trying to get in here on a Friday or Sat night is hell! I don't know of they still do the DJ on Thursday nights but it's so loud you can barely hear yourself speak.  It's nothing special when you talk about chain restaurants but they are hanging in there. Hopefully service continues to get better and they expand their menu and add newer food choices at least every 6 to 12 months.

Went here today, rain pouring very hard.  My Husband and I arrived at 11:15AM.  We were one of 3 tables sat around the same time.  Our server was polite, she didn't suggest anything, nor ask if it was our first time, which it was.  My Husband ordered the "really good cheese burger" with sweet potato fries, I ordered the shrimp naan/flat bread sandwich, and a chicken quesadilla for the app.  The appetizer came out after 15 min.  It tasted really good, very flavorful, and hot.  There was a watery glob of sour cream and LITERALLY a teaspoon of pico and looked like some day old dark brown guacamole. It tasted awesome though.   My husband's burger and my shrimp naan was brought out about 30 minutes after our appetizer.  They were out of sweet potato fries, so the server made the decision to give my husband regular fries without asking if he wanted a side salad, or anything else.   He ordered his burger medium, it was well done.  My shrimp naan was a weird mix of good and bad.  The thing that ruined it was that the naan bread was burnt.  They smeared the burnt crispy side with cucumber dressing.  The cucumber dressing was good, and it had loads of garlic, but again the burnt taste overpowered everything. It was hard to hold like a wrap because it was so crispy.  Shrimp were plentiful, I didn't see a lick of balsamic glaze.  Alot of people I know love TGI Fridays, but I honestly was not impressed.  Oh...my fries were good.  Our server never refilled our waters, another server did.   As we walked out we saw that THEY HAVE A 74C HEALTH SCORE.  ONE OF THE VIOLATIONS WAS FOOD NOT BEING HELD OR SERVED AT PROPER TEMPERATURES.   Bathrooms were clean.   As long as it took to get our food, I'd be afraid to eat here on a weekend night.   Wont be back.

Food came out and it took about ten minutes before we got our utensils. Ordered a medium rare steak and got a well done steak. The table next to us was not cleaned down but the hostess sat some ppl down there anyways.

The worst experience I've ever had at any restaurant! I went there Sunday for my first ever Father's Day (beautiful baby girl). From the time we walked in till the time we left it was terrible. Host not very friendly. We were seated waited forever after we order on our drinks and food. Had to ask multiple times for utensils. Food was cold and overcooked. We watched a waiter eat off a customers plate before leaving the kitchen area and we reported it to a manager because that's disgusting and who wants to eat food someone touched. The manager made a big deal to us like he was going to handle it. We later realized it was more important to rub your bartenders shoulders. Terrible terrible experience I wouldn't recommend his place to my enemies!! And didn't notice the health score until we left which was a 71 for multiple food violations. Improper storing of food time and temperature abuse...

Went to TGIF today after church (and the mall). The atmosphere was typical for TGIF. I tried something new today. I had the Turkey Burger and side salad (trying to eat better).  Burger =520 calories!  It was SOOOOOOOO GOOOD!!  I was stuffed and didn't overeat!  For $11, it was well worth it!  I will definitely go back for another one very soon.  The staff was very nice and the restaurant was clean. No complaints on my end!!!

This place is horrible walked in the place waited to be seated over 5 to10 mins had past and no one ever showed up to seat us. The host was seated by the door she answered the phone and sat back down. So eventually we left.

Unfortunately at this location service has gone down. Long wait times even though the restaurant is not crowded. I assume they are short staffed. Food was overcooked and tasted like it was yesterday's left over.

I went here after work the other night. I ordered the endless boneless wings right the whole time I was there I only got two orders of these. I was there for like over a hour.  The service is slow and I guess they only have one cook in the back.. I won't come here again. I really wanted to go to town with this endless boneless wings. I had my mind thinking g I was going to have like 4 or 5 plates of them but the service is slow so I only got 2 plates. Smh
Prolly second time coming here or third and service still sucks ... bartenders sucks haven't received a sweet tea from bartender after 40 minutes of arriving Terrance smh sad sad sad bad service

Update: So I decided to try this TGI Fridays location again and I had a much better experience! The waitress was very nice and efficient! Our food was absolutely delicious! We went for lunch around 11:30 am.

I haven't been to Frida's in a while due to the service.  This time my husband and I set at the bar and our waitress Devetta was awesome. She not only make the bomb Cocktails , but also her service was impeccable!!! The food was good and we didn't have to wait long at all. Devetta was very attentive as well. We will definitely be back!!!!

Do NOT come here for steak. This was my second attempt in several months and again,  extremely disappointed.  Not once, but twice I received a well done steak when asking for medium. There was no way I was going to sit and hope the third time would be a charm. Luckily I ordered wings which were ok but will not consider coming to this place again when I want steak. What happens TGIF? You guys uses to be good.

Our server was great but the food was a 2/10. I ate it because it was food and I was hungry. First of all don't cook shrimp first ! Everyone should know that. When our food got brought out the shrimp clearly had been sitting for a long time and that why our fried shrimp that was expected hot were cold. Secondly the mac and cheese taste like creamy cereal , it had no flavor . Straight garbage. The server was kind enough to allow me to replace the item , I was too afraid to dare to get anything that needed to be hot so I asked for cole slaw to be on the safe side. When the cole slaw came out , I promise it had to be expired . It smelled and looked funny . I wouldn't give it to a dog. It's safe to say I won't be returning.

I have only been there once after I picked up my kid from a red eye flight. The time was around 11pm.They literally had one male customer two after I picked up my son. First of all we were told there was no seating so we went to the bar but since there was plenty of seating near the bar we sat at a table unassisted. My son ordered a burger and fries. I ordered a salad. My sons order was cold though the cold fry tasted like it could be good if hot and I was impressed with the quality and taste of his hamburger bun it was just cold. I thought to myself hmm I'm going to visit another TGIF they might have good food. Soooo I ordered a salad and the waitress sets it down with a nasty look. I kid you not by the time I finished with that salad a had a blister on my tongue and was swearing up and down they gave me herpes. I don't know what they gave me but it caused a blister so I don't go there. Now let me deal with the patrons the one man had eyes for me and at least three women criticized my hair it was a cat scene in there and when I left the one man had three women around him = so strange definitely not a place to take your man or look for a man it's barracuda city.
Staff is great. Food is typical Friday's fare but everyone here couldn't be nicer or more attentive.  Highly recommend if you're in from out of town.

I've been a tgi fridays patron for years withy visits steadily for years.  Tonight proves why I WON'T be coming back.  My waitress was nice but I can't the way this place is ran.  My hubby and I had a 20 minute wait which was fine because it was Saturday and it was late.  I couldn't access my account so he decided to get a rewards account.  Immediately after signing up, he received an offer for a free appetizer or a desert. We told our server immediately and she said it was fine. Actually we ordered our appetizer and food at the exact same time so there would be no issues.  Our appetizer came out quickly which was great.  We had to eat with our hands because our waitress after asking 3x forgot our silverware, but that was fine since it was onion rings. Strike 1.  Our food, the ribs, took 45 minutes with no explanation as to why. Strike 2.  After the THIRD time asking which I started showing how annoyed I was, I finally got my silverware. But lo and behold, there was food on my fork and on my husbands knife. Not only that but I couldn't find my waitress and had to walk to the bar who only had 1. I had to go really close to the kitchen area to find my waitress and to get it.  But my annoyance and what really pissed me off was the fact that the ribs are considered a promo and cant be combined with the free appetizer. There was no way anyone could override it from what I was told. Strike 3.  This visit was utter and complete b.s. I am beyond disgusted that this restaurant still hasnt gotten together. Something needs to be done. I won't be coming back and I plan on spreading the word.

I am sooo upset with this restaurant!  It actually used to be one of my favorite restaurants a couple of years ago. I have had the worst of experiences there today. I am a veteran and today is Veterans Day.  TGIFriday's had a special menu just for the veterans today, so my boyfriend and I decided to meet with his friend here and we were going to have a good meal here among us 3 veterans.... or so I thought! When we got there it was extremely packed, so I put our names on the waiting list. I was told it would be a 30 to 35 minute wait. I was already really hungry, but we decided to eat there anyway because I told my boyfriend what a great restaurant this was. We waited in the car and I checked after 25 minutes just to see where we were on the list. There was a different hostess at the stand and she informed me it would be another 20 minutes. I told her that would put us at a 45 minute wait when we were originally told 30 minutes. She just kind of shrugged me off saying "we're waiting for other tables to open up". So I return to the car to wait.  Not even 10 minutes had gone by, and I'm extremely hungry at this point, so I'm thinking we could just go stand by the door to wait. When I looked at the waiting list, our names were scratched out!  I then asked her why she skipped us and she shrugs me off again, saying "we called on y'all 2 times a long time ago." I told her "you said 20 minutes more than 10 minutes ago!" She said to me "well, now it's an hour's wait." That made me so upset, I didn't know what to do!  I mean, you have hungry veterans at your establishment and THIS is how you treat them???

One of the few TGIs still open in metro Atlanta. The atmosphere is what gives this place the edge over other nearby competitors. Even if you only go for a drink or two, I highly recommend it: Food: I get my usual sizzling chicken and shrimp when I come here and it always comes out sizzling just like it says. This time I decided to try something different, and got the Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp. Magnifique! I'm a picky eater, and usually when I find something I like I stick with it. It's worth sampling the menu here. You might be pleasantly surprised.  Drinks: I get alcohol whenever I come here. This location has drink "specials" nightly, no happy hour but good prices. Though it's not on the menu anymore, the bar still made my favorite blackberry martini drank. The dark and stormy and the Strawberry Hennessy cocktail is also delicious.  Parking: it gets crowded here, even on Mondays and the like. People come here to eat and enjoy the atmosphere so go early, spaces can be limited.  Service/Atmosphere: again, can't speak highly enough about the great atmosphere here. I will bypass other eateries that I really like in favor of this place. There is a DJ in the evenings, games upstairs and sports on the tv. I saw a kids' birthday gathering as well. Literally something for everyone but if "fun" isn't your thing then choose another location. This isn't your typical, quiet-ish TGIs. While wait times varied on the day I was there, the servers were always apologetic when ever I did have to wait long. I won't pretend to understand how seating works, but I was confused by the wait whenever there were open seats.  The lively atmosphere and the quality food and drank keep me returning. As long as these two things are consistent I'll be consistent with my dollar.

Me and my sister came here on Friday & it wasn't the best experience. We went late in the evening so there was a decent crowd. We waited 30min to be seated in the loft upstairs It took forever for me to get my drink. By the time I got my drink I was halfway thru my meal. When the bartender came with my drink she seemed to have an attitude. Not my fault my waitress was elsewhere n u had to bring ur ass from behind the bar to give me my drink. The food was mediocre nothing great. Then they have the nerve to have a game night flyers on the tables but don't have what it offers. Then I had to ask 3 ppl the price of the Jell-O shots they offered but didn't have. If you put time advertising something you could at least have it. Overall it was so-so. Don't expect great service, plus some of the games can be loud!! Ur no Dave-n-buster

Service is slow. The wait for tables is long and you see more tables open then people waiting. Food is always good though. Just very slow service and not very attentive servers. Have been there three times with the same issues. Most of the time it is even on weekdays. Not during busy weekend times.

Stonecrest location  Terrible service. Waited over 20 minutes for a table even though there were plenty of unoccupied tables. We were told this was due to lack of servers.  Server was very unfriendly  No silverware we had to eat with plastic forks  The server neglected to let us know that a menu item was not available and we waited for 30 minutes for the food. Only to be told it wasn't on the menu. Manager was very unconcerned with the terrible service and offered no accommodations  This is consistent with the terrible service at this location and we will not be returning ever again.

Just Horrible look at Picture order WHISKEY-GLAZED SLIDERS MADE WITH JACK DANIEL'S® suppose to have cheese and sauceHorrible food don't eat there or order via UberEat. And this my second time the first time I got Ribs they were dry and nasty thought they couldn't mess up a slider but yes they did....    Update: I gave them a third time and still they couldn't get it right worst food ever....Never again....

Came in for lunch for my husbands birthday. We brought our two kids. Even though they were out of chicken fingers for the kids, the food was good. Both kids got the pasta with marinara sauce and they liked it. My husband got the hickory smoked chicken and added fried shrimp. He really liked his meal. I drank a tropical Long Island iced tea. It was ok, I would have liked for it to be a little stronger. Our server was nice and polite. Food came out fast. Overall a good experience. We will be back.

This TGIF Fridays location is awesome. There is plenty of parking and if the parking lot gets full you can park in a neighboring lot. On the weekends Friday and Saturday nights the restaurant tends to get crowded. There are 2 levels with a bar on each. I like coming to Friday's for their all day happy hour drinks. The prices are excellent and it's quality alcohol. My favorite drink is the Titos Strawberry Mule, the presentation is nice and it taste delicious. The customer service here is good whether you are sitting at a table or at the bar the experience for me has been consistent. Since I'm a pescatarian my favorite dish is the Whiskey- Glazed  Shrimp which comes with  fries. It's not the healthiest dish on the menu but it is scrumptious every time. I also enjoy the Grilled Salmon on days when i want something I wont regret eating. TGIF Fridays is a nice spot to bring the entire family, meet up with friends or even a nice casual date. It's also a great spot to watch the game  if you are lucky enough to get a seat at the bar.
Food was good. No complaints. Our server Charlie was very friendly and inviting. We didn't ask for much but I'm sure he would've helped with no problems. Great experience thanks to him.

I was going to mind my business about what I saw last night but it was still on my spirit today. I was sitting at the bar last night watching the falcons game and there were 2 girls , a slim light skin girl with big black hair and a dark sun girl with braids or something talking. I heard the lighter girl say "bitch! I'm not the one! " and I was startled. I noticed the darker bartender walking away and the other one kept saying "bitch! I'm not the one" I was sitting right in front of the beer container and I was surprised she continued although I was still sitting there eating my appetizer ,which was subpar and watching the Falcons game but her demeanor never changed. She continued to curse behind the bar at the other girl as though there would be a physical altercation. As far as I could tell the darker girl wasn't saying much , yet the lighter toned female kept being aggressive. It was very distasteful and something I might expect to see at a more urban location. I will not be back to visit this establishment and I hope that this behavior isn't something that's tolerated.
